attributes.action: Open a Polling Station at Glastonbury Music Festival for proposed EU referendum
attributes.background: The 23rd June 2016 is being touted as a potential date for the proposed EU referendum vote. So as to ensure Glastonbury festival goers can exercise their democratic right un-impinged by the clash of dates, it would be ideal for a Polling Station to be opened on the site of the festival.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Polling stations are the responsibility of local authorities.

You could contact the organisers of Glastonbury Festival, to see if they can arrange a polling station to be located at the Festival through their local authority, using the following website: http://www.glastonburyfestivals.co.uk/contact-us/
